Posts.Content: hi amy, i had fec x 6  and used the cold cap twice but hair started coming out everywhere, couldnt bear it so like you i shaved it off and must admit felt better for it at the time,  then you get to the impatient stage of thinking that it'll never grow back,  it does trust me it was the middle of april that i shaved it, lost my lashes and eyebrows after 5 fec, had my last chemo was 3rd july, eyelashes brows and legs and lady bits came back with a vengence after about 6 weeks. i finally plucked up the courage to go without scarves on the 9 september so roughly 8 - 9 weeks from last chemo i had a hair cut similar to grade one skinhead,   my hair now is roughly 1 inch all over and is very thick and full 18 weeks from last chemo. keep smiling amy you'll get there i promise you xx
Posts.Title: when does your hair come back

Posts.Content: hi lettie if nothing else get it checked for your own peace of mind as you are obviously worried enough to have joined this forum best wishes helen xx
Posts.Title: How can you tell?

Posts.Content: hi kitty, i had genetic testing back in april, i had a meeting with a genetic counseller to to inform me about the consequences of knowing and not knowing and whether i was sure that i wanted to know if i had bcra1 or 2 gene, then it was a simple blood test and a 6 week wait for results helen x
Posts.Title: Genetic Test tomorrow

Posts.Content: Hi Jenny I finished chemo and rads august 2012 after lumpectomy and 3 nodes removed and still am very tender, i thinks its the radiotherapy thats done it for me, mammograms are ouch. Helen xx
Posts.Title: Tender still after a year .

Posts.Content: marilyn your hairs cominhg through really quickly, mine must be slow growing :-( karen, unkempt head of pubes lol. id spend an hour in the mirror each morning straightening and faffing about with my hair before all this palava , im definatley less vain than before but still can't wait till around the summer time when i should be able to choose my own style ratther than having to live with the pubes lol helen xx
Posts.Title: curly hair

Posts.Content: hi ladies, i have been finished chemo 6 months now and my hair is roughly 1 1/2 inches long and very curly, my hair prior to chemo was very long and had a kink to it . is everyones or after chemo hair curly ? does it stay curly ? take care helen xx
Posts.Title: curly hair

Posts.Content: hi honey bea, how long is your hair ? i finished my chemo last week and would just like an idea on growth rate, also how long do you think it is before your body realizes that it has to keep your now rather than keep spitting it out xx
Posts.Title: CHANGING HAIR COLOUR FROM GREY TO BLONDE AFTER CHEMO?

Posts.Content: thanks yvonne and LM, i do quite like the curls, my mom sais i look like a posh bird with a pixie cut and curls lol, my colour is what it was before a mousey blonde, i also went to egypt in november which gave me really nice natural highlights so haven't dyed it yet but dare say i will before long as i was always bottle blonde helen xx
Posts.Title: curly hair

Posts.Content: marilyn i think you're right about it relaxing once its a bit longer, when did you finish your chemo ?
Posts.Title: curly hair

Posts.Content: hi jelly they gave me an ibuprofen type cream to rub in 3 or 4 times a day and was told to massage with moisteriser whilst watching tv and keep doing those stretches stretches stretches and i know it hurts but it really does help jamesy 6 times in the same arm OUCH it makes my eyes water thinking about i was able to have 3 in each, i dont know how i would of managed if i hadn't
Posts.Title: Sore arm/vein pain

Posts.Content: clare maybe it depends on how many lymph nodes were removed , i had 4 removed but they still used which ever arm i asked them too, the one time that epi was really sore going in they slowed the rate at which it was going in and also increased the rate of saline which helped loads . helen x
Posts.Title: Sore good arm

Posts.Content: i was prescribed a ibuprofen type cream which does help with the pain, lots of stretching and massaging really does help, i would suggest having your next chemo in your opposite arm to give your veins on that side chance to heal abit i know its easy for me to say now but i know exactly how you fee and it does get better 2 weeks after last chemo and veins feels better already, i do think it physcological too knowing that my 3 weekly dose of fec isn't coming  helen x
Posts.Title: Sore good arm

Posts.Content: Although i hardly ever post on here, i do still have all email notifications sent to my phone from this group, this morning i received one that marian43 started about her being newly diagnosed and having terrible nightmares  , at reading this i turned to my boyfriend and said , poor woman , do you remember at the beginning back in feb  and i.d wake my self up with the sobbing it still makes me feel sick to think how afraid i was back then,  he sais yeah but you need to forget about it now. He then started to to tell me about an article he had read in the paper about a young woman of 23 that has breast cancer and also a had a double mx due to her carrying the bcra1 gene, obviously you instantly feel for her, he then went on to say, its a real shame because she was like a page 3 model. pretty with big boobs. i said to him is it not a real shame for Jane smith from accounts with her normal looks and 36B boobs ? he sais it would of been different if she was 60. my hackles started to come up then and i couldn't hold my tongue , would he have said it wouldn't have been so bad if she was 60 if it had been his mother ? No i don't think so,     I don't understand how someone that has been through this shit with me can say stuff like that. Please am i being over sensitive  or is he an arse ?
Posts.Title: Am i just being touchy ?

Posts.Content: thank you for your opinions ladies, sometimes i seriously think its me, its nice to know that i'm not a raving lunatic after all, and that he really is just an ARSE helen xxx
Posts.Title: Am i just being touchy ?
